1387855417196351489.text: I want to work with whoever is willing to continue our economic recovery, get people back to work, secure the border, fix our broken immigration system, fix our bridges, roads, highways & ports, address hate crimes & bring our country together.

1387855415858417664.text: Our nation faces many challenges. I have heard from small business owners in #CA39, seen the crisis at the border & experienced our infrastructure challenges firsthand.

1387855414184796164.text: The bills he mentioned were rushed through the House without even allowing for bipartisan input & would kill jobs, hurt workers, stifle innovation in the gig economy, drastically hike federal spending & throw money at problems rather than finding real, long-lasting solutions.

What we witnessed today was abhorrent & not what America stands for. 

I hope today’s events showed each of us that we need to move forward, deescalate our rhetoric & work together to heal our wounds for the future of our democracy & our nation. https://t.co/iJZYSntu2d

1346953894094659585.text:
My family came to the U.S. to achieve the American dream. Now I'm serving as a member of Congress for the community I call home. 

What we have witnessed today is not who we are.

We must condemn this violence & work together to heal our wounds. More unites us than divides us.

1346919064690683906.text:
My team & I are safe. Thank you to our law enforcement who are putting their lives on the line.

Peaceful protests are a First Amendment right & fundamental to our democracy, but violence is unacceptable. 

The chaos & violence we're seeing at the Capitol must stop immediately.

1346487966080921600.text: Thank you, @RepRaskin, for this beautiful tribute to your son Tommy. I am sure this only scratches the surface of what an incredible young man he was. As a mother of four, I can only imagine what you are going through. Please know I am thinking of you & Sarah during this time. https://t.co/oCQM8N77SU

1346284030442934273.text:
I sat down with the @latimes as I moved into my Congressional office to talk about my first day, #CA39’s priorities, & being one of the first Korean-American women in Congress. 

I am ready to get to work to represent my community.
https://t.co/xvDqZcNv34

1346262469333815296.text:
Sandi was a dear friend. She supported me during my daughter's cancer battle & taught me to live life with no regrets. 

My heart breaks that this terrible disease took her life & my thoughts are with her loved ones during this difficult time. 
https://t.co/dQy4nJvRow

1346108126890758145.text:
I have thick skin, because I came here to get one thing done: to ensure that the American dream that I was able to achieve is also available for the next generation.
https://t.co/uHUEEvnHMj

1345901167231062017.text: I came to Washington to cut through the gridlock, find bipartisan solutions, and be an independent voice for this community. Now it’s time to get to work.

1345901161153499136.text: I raised my family, built my career and achieved the American Dream in the 39th District and I am honored to be able to fight for it everyday in Congress.

1345901157839986688.text: It is the honor of a lifetime to represent the community I have cherished so much in Congress, and I thank the people of the 39th District for putting their trust in me. https://t.co/m8gYWuXKkN

1345794128907534336.text: Great to see you, my friend! Glad to have you as a partner in representing Southern California and serving as the first Korean-American women in Congress. https://t.co/kba4U0C4Cd

1345746102457348096.text:
I just got my member badge and member pin. It’s official! 🇺🇸

I can’t believe I’m here now and look forward to representing #CA39. https://t.co/Q13RqDlQlO

1345518563885461504.text:
It’s happening! 👀
